greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First nonzero value of a^(p-1) - 1 mod p^2, for a > 0 coprime to the n-th Wieferich prime p.
comment: It is believed that a(n) = 3^(p-1) - 1 mod p^2 for all n, where p = A001220(n).
See additional comments, references, links and cross-references in A001220.
link: A. Ostafe and I. Shparlinski (2010), Pseudorandomness and Dynamics of Fermat Quotients
example: The first Wieferich prime is 1093 and a^1092 - 1 mod 1093^2 = 0, 0, 341016 for a = 1, 2, 3, so a(1) = 341016.
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Jun 23 2010
